div.p:
Paint Rock Graduation will be held in the Bill May Gymnasium as scheduled on Saturday, May 30, 2020 at 6pm.
Social distancing norms will be practiced, and ALL invited guests will be required to wear a mask for the duration of the ceremony.
This event is NOT open to the public, unfortunately, but the Seniors will help us coordinate who is invited to attend their graduation, as each Senior will be issued six tickets to invite the six guests they would like to have there.
Thank you
Staff please plan to attend. You are invited and will be seated at least 6 feet from each other.

span.span: Out of an abundance of caution and concern for the safety and well-being of its students, parents, teachers, and staff, the Paint Rock Independent School District will remain closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. The district’s teachers and staff will continue to provide on-line and long distance instruction as well as meal services for our students.
Both High School and Kindergarten Graduations will still take place in a modified arrangement. Both graduations will be live-streamed. Details are still being worked out.

The district has been providing on-line and long distance instruction, as well as meal service for its students since Monday, March 16 (the first day of school following Governor Abbott’s original emergency declaration).
The faculty and staff have done an incredible job serving our students, parents and community during these difficult times.

Mr. Ron Cline
Superintendent
Paint Rock ISD
The informational graphic below is from Texas Health and Human Services.

p.span: * We are still accepting new students. If you know a family who is looking for a small school who has great students and a caring staff, then send them our way!

span.span: “The Board of Trustees for the Paint Rock Independent School District meets at least once a month for regular school board meetings. These meetings take place at 6:00pm in the school Cafeteria on the second Monday of each month. School Board Agendas are located under the Administration - Board Of Education tab.

Public Notification of Nondiscrimination in Career and Technical Education (Vocational) Programs
Paint Rock Independent School District offers career and technical education programs in business, family and consumer sciences, agriculture, computers and education. Admission to these programs is open to all PRISD high school students.
It is the policy of Paint Rock ISD not to discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex or handicap in its vocational programs, services or activities as required by Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, as amended; Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972; and Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended.
It is the policy of Paint Rock ISD not to discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, handicap, or age in its employment practices as required by Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, as amended; Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972; the Age Discrimination Act of 1975, as amended; and Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended.
Paint Rock ISD will take steps to assure that lack of English language skills will not be a barrier to admission and participation in all educational and vocational programs.
For information about your rights or grievance procedures, contact the Superintendent, Ron Cline or Allison Tonne, Principal and Title IX Coordinator at 698 S. Sims, Paint Rock, Texas 76866, 325-732-4314.
If you have any questions or concerns, please call us at

span.span: Click Here To Report Any Student Health/Safety or Bullying Incident
If you have a child in the 6th – 8th grades, please read the following information!

Please sign up for Remind 101! With Remind 101 you will be able to join a texting program that allows me as the teacher to keep you updated with what is going on inside the classroom. I will be sending out reminder texts that will inform you when your child has an assignment due, quiz, test, and so forth. Both you and your child can sign up to the reminder texts!
To sign up for your child’s specific class please do the following:
Click here to sign up for Paint Rock ISD Remind Messaging Service.

p.span: Want to become a strong leader? Want to learn about life skills? Want to have fun, explore and discover?
If you have any questions, please call the Extension Office at 325-732-4304.
